tools.detailed_description: Create new Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs) by combining generative AI and simulation on HPC infrastructure.

tools.name: Goma
tools.one_line_profile: Full-Newton Finite Element Program for multiphysics problems
tools.detailed_description: A Full-Newton Finite Element Program for Free and Moving Boundary Problems with Coupled Fluid/Solid Momentum, Energy, Mass, and Chemical Species Transport.

tools.name: JAX-CFD
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Fluid Dynamics in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A library for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) written in JAX, enabling differentiable physics and TPU acceleration.

tools.name: OpenSayal
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time GPU accelerated fluid simulator
tools.detailed_description: Real-time GPU accelerated fluid simulator designed for high performance.

tools.name: GridapDistributed.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed-memory parallel extension for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: Parallel distributed-memory version of Gridap, a Julia library for grid-based approximations of partial differential equations.

tools.name: GridapPETSc.jl
tools.one_line_profile: PETSc interface for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: Provides PETSc solvers to the Gridap project, enabling scalable linear and nonlinear solvers for FEM.

tools.name: parallel
tools.one_line_profile: Stata module for parallel computing
tools.detailed_description: A Stata module to implement parallel computing, accelerating statistical analysis and simulations.

tools.name: sparselizard
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance C++ FEM library for multiphysics
tools.detailed_description: A fast, user-friendly, multiphysics, hp-adaptive finite element C++ library tailored for high-performance computing.

tools.name: Halide
tools.one_line_profile: Language for fast, portable data-parallel computation
tools.detailed_description: A programming language designed to make it easier to write high-performance image and array processing code on modern machines.

tools.name: DeepLM
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale Nonlinear Least Squares solver on Deep Learning Frameworks
tools.detailed_description: DeepLM enables large-scale Nonlinear Least Squares solving on Deep Learning Frameworks using Stochastic Domain Decomposition.

tools.name: HPDDM
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance domain decomposition methods framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for high-performance domain decomposition methods, providing efficient solvers for large-scale linear systems.

tools.name: raccoon
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel FEM code for phase-field fracture
tools.detailed_description: Massively parallel Finite Element Method (FEM) code for phase-field modeling of fracture, developed by Dolbow Lab at Duke University.

tools.name: sxamg
tools.one_line_profile: Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) Solver Library
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) methods for solving large sparse linear systems.

tools.name: hypre
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable linear solvers and multigrid methods
tools.detailed_description: Library of high-performance preconditioners and solvers for the solution of large, sparse linear systems of equations on massively parallel computers.

tools.name: hyStrath
tools.one_line_profile: Hypersonic and rarefied gas dynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A simulation code for hypersonic and rarefied gas dynamics, suitable for aerospace engineering applications.

tools.name: BlackBear
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of degradation processes in concrete and structural materials
tools.detailed_description: BlackBear is a MOOSE-based code for simulating degradation processes in concrete and other structural materials.

tools.name: MaCaw
tools.one_line_profile: Domain-decomposed neutral particle transport application
tools.detailed_description: MaCaw is a MOOSE-based application that enables domain-decomposed neutral particle transport calculations, leveraging ray tracing and OpenMC.

tools.name: Mastodon
tools.one_line_profile: Structural dynamics and seismic analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A MOOSE-based application for structural dynamics, seismic analysis, and risk assessment.

tools.name: MOOSE
tools.one_line_profile: Multiphysics Object Oriented Simulation Environment
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, finite element, multiphysics framework that simplifies the development of advanced simulation tools.

tools.name: Idefix
tools.one_line_profile: Fast finite volume code for astrophysical flows
tools.detailed_description: A fast finite volume code designed to run on many architectures (GPU, CPU) using Kokkos, primarily for astrophysical fluid dynamics.

tools.name: Inductiva
tools.one_line_profile: API for large-scale physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python API to execute large-scale physics simulations on the cloud, simplifying access to HPC resources.

tools.name: SundialsML
tools.one_line_profile: OCaml interface to the Sundials suite of numeric solvers
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive interface for the OCaml language to the Sundials suite of numerical solvers, enabling high-performance solving of ODEs and DAEs in a functional programming environment.

tools.name: PFC3D_OpenFOAM
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling interface for PFC3D and OpenFOAM for fluid-particle interaction
tools.detailed_description: A coupling tool that integrates PFC3D (Particle Flow Code) with OpenFOAM to model fluid-particle interactions, enabling complex multiphysics simulations involving granular media and fluids.

tools.name: petsc4foam
tools.one_line_profile: Library to use PETSc linear solvers within the OpenFOAM framework
tools.detailed_description: An experimental library that embeds PETSc's high-performance linear solvers into OpenFOAM, aiming to accelerate CFD simulations through advanced preconditioning and solver algorithms.

tools.name: JAGURS
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel tsunami simulation code solving long-wave/Boussinesq equations
tools.detailed_description: A tsunami simulation code that solves linear/nonlinear long-wave and Boussinesq equations, supporting effects like elastic earth deformation and seawater density stratification, parallelized with OpenMP and MPI.

tools.name: CfdOF
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Fluid Dynamics workbench for FreeCAD using OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A FreeCAD workbench that integrates OpenFOAM solvers, allowing users to perform CFD simulations directly within the FreeCAD environment, from mesh generation to solving.

tools.name: sparse
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse matrix formats and linear algebra library for Go
tools.detailed_description: A Go library providing sparse matrix formats (CSR, CSC, etc.) and linear algebra operations, designed to support scientific computing and machine learning applications in the Go ecosystem.

tools.name: octree-mg
tools.one_line_profile: MPI geometric multigrid solver for quadtree/octree grids
tools.detailed_description: A geometric multigrid solver designed for quadtree (2D) and octree (3D) grids, utilizing MPI for parallel execution, suitable for solving PDEs on adaptive meshes.

tools.name: Puffin
tools.one_line_profile: Phase Field coupled with crystal plasticity solver based on MOOSE
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool built on the MOOSE framework that couples phase field methods with crystal plasticity to model microstructure evolution and mechanical response in materials.

tools.name: adios4dolfinx
tools.one_line_profile: Checkpointing and I/O extension for DOLFINx using ADIOS2
tools.detailed_description: A library extending DOLFINx with advanced checkpointing capabilities using ADIOS2, facilitating efficient I/O for large-scale finite element simulations and restarts.

tools.name: dolfinx_mpc
tools.one_line_profile: Extension for DOLFINx to handle multi-point constraints
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the DOLFINx finite element library that enables the definition and enforcement of multi-point constraints (MPC), such as periodic boundary conditions or rigid body motions.

tools.name: mpres-blas
tools.one_line_profile: Multiple-precision GPU accelerated linear algebra routines
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated library for dense and sparse linear algebra operations supporting multiple-precision arithmetic based on residue number systems, targeting high-precision scientific computing.

tools.name: Kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: C++ Performance Portability Programming Ecosystem for HPC
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive C++ programming model and library for writing performance-portable applications that run efficiently on diverse HPC architectures (multicore CPUs, GPUs, etc.) by abstracting memory and execution models.

tools.name: Kokkos Comm
tools.one_line_profile: Experimental Explicit Communications API for Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: An experimental library within the Kokkos ecosystem providing explicit communication APIs (like MPI abstractions) designed to work seamlessly with Kokkos's execution and memory spaces.

tools.name: kokkos-fft
tools.one_line_profile: Shared-memory FFT library for the Kokkos HPC ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A library providing Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) capabilities designed to work seamlessly within the Kokkos performance portability ecosystem, enabling efficient spectral methods on diverse HPC architectures.

tools.name: kokkos-fortran-interop
tools.one_line_profile: Interoperability tools for mixing Fortran and Kokkos C++ code
tools.detailed_description: Provides interfaces and tools to facilitate the interaction between legacy Fortran scientific codes and modern C++ Kokkos performance-portable components, essential for modernizing HPC applications.

tools.name: kokkos-kernels
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable math kernels (BLAS, Sparse, Graph) for Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A collection of high-performance mathematical kernels including dense BLAS, sparse linear algebra, and graph algorithms, optimized for various hardware backends supported by Kokkos.

tools.name: kokkos-remote-spaces
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed memory extension for Kokkos using PGAS concepts
tools.detailed_description: Extends Kokkos with distributed memory capabilities, allowing for Partitioned Global Address Space (PGAS) semantics to manage data across nodes in HPC clusters.

tools.name: kokkos-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Profiling and debugging suite for the Kokkos ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A set of dynamic tools for profiling, debugging, and analyzing the performance of Kokkos-based scientific applications, helping developers optimize code for HPC architectures.

tools.name: PyKokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable parallel programming framework for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework that provides performance portability for scientific computing by leveraging Kokkos C++ backend, allowing Python users to write high-performance parallel code.

tools.name: pykokkos-base
tools.one_line_profile: Low-level Python bindings for Kokkos data structures
tools.detailed_description: Provides the fundamental bindings for Kokkos Views and other data structures to Python, serving as the interoperability layer for PyKokkos and other hybrid applications.

tools.name: openInjMoldSim
tools.one_line_profile: Open source injection molding simulation solver for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A specialized solver based on OpenFOAM for simulating the injection molding process, including flow and thermal analysis for manufacturing engineering.

tools.name: Butterfly
tools.one_line_profile: Python API for creating and running OpenFOAM CFD cases
tools.detailed_description: A library that serves as a Python interface to OpenFOAM, allowing users to generate, run, and manage Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations, often used in environmental design workflows.

tools.name: LAMMPS
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator
tools.detailed_description: A classical molecular dynamics code with a focus on materials modeling. It's designed to run efficiently on parallel computers and supports a wide range of interatomic potentials and boundary conditions.

tools.name: MATAR
tools.one_line_profile: Portable dense and sparse data representation library for Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library developed at LANL to facilitate the creation of portable dense and sparse data structures, leveraging Kokkos to ensure performance across different HPC architectures.

tools.name: MF-LBM
tools.one_line_profile: Portable Lattice Boltzmann Code for flow in porous media
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance, scalable Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) solver designed for Direct Numerical Simulation (DNS) of fluid flow in porous media, supporting multi-architecture execution.

tools.name: PROGRESS
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel graph-based recursive electronic structure solver
tools.detailed_description: A rapid O(N) electronic structure solver developed at LANL, utilizing graph-based recursive methods for quantum mechanical simulations of materials.

tools.name: vpic-kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Kokkos-ported Vector Particle-In-Cell (VPIC) code
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable version of the VPIC plasma physics simulation code, rewritten using Kokkos to run efficiently on various GPU and CPU architectures.

tools.name: CRANE
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE application for chemical reaction networks in plasma
tools.detailed_description: An application built on the MOOSE framework for simulating general Chemical Reaction Networks, specifically targeting plasma chemistry and thermochemistry problems.

tools.name: EJML
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Java Matrix Library for dense and sparse matrices
tools.detailed_description: A fast and easy-to-use linear algebra library written in Java, supporting dense, sparse, real, and complex matrices, widely used in scientific computing within the Java ecosystem.

tools.name: libMesh
tools.one_line_profile: C++ framework for numerical simulation of partial differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for the numerical simulation of partial differential equations using adaptive finite element methods, providing mesh handling and parallel computing capabilities.

tools.name: SUSA
tools.one_line_profile: High Performance Computing and Signal Processing Framework
tools.detailed_description: A C++ framework designed for high-performance computing tasks and signal processing applications, providing optimized algorithms and structures.

tools.name: LifeV
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel finite element library for multiphysics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for Finite Element simulations, focusing on multiphysics problems such as fluid-structure interaction and hemodynamics, developed by a consortium of research institutions.

tools.name: CudaDMA
tools.one_line_profile: Library for emulating DMA engines on GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library that enables the emulation of Direct Memory Access (DMA) engines on CUDA-enabled GPUs, facilitating efficient data movement and performance portability in HPC applications.

tools.name: madupite
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance distributed solver for Markov Decision Processes
tools.detailed_description: A distributed solver for large-scale Markov Decision Processes (MDP) utilizing inexact policy iteration, designed for high performance on HPC systems.

tools.name: ambit
tools.one_line_profile: FEniCSx-based cardiovascular multi-physics solver
tools.detailed_description: A specialized solver built on FEniCSx for cardiovascular multi-physics simulations, including solid mechanics, fluid dynamics, and growth/remodeling models.

tools.name: IGA-dealii
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) extension for the deal.II finite element library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library that extends deal.II to support Isogeometric Analysis (IGA), enabling the use of NURBS and other spline-based basis functions for solving partial differential equations.

tools.name: WaveBEM
tools.one_line_profile: Unsteady nonlinear potential flow solver for ship-wave interaction
tools.detailed_description: A Boundary Element Method (BEM) solver designed for simulating unsteady nonlinear potential flows, specifically focused on ship-wave interactions in hydrodynamics.

tools.name: deal2lkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit library for enhancing deal.II functionality
tools.detailed_description: A utility library that provides additional tools and modules for the deal.II finite element library, facilitating the development of complex FEA solvers.

tools.name: pi-BEM
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Boundary Element Method (BEM) solver
tools.detailed_description: A parallel implementation of the Boundary Element Method for solving partial differential equations, designed for high-performance computing environments.

tools.name: pi-DoMUS
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel multiphysics solver based on deal.II
tools.detailed_description: A parallel multiphysics solver built on top of the deal.II library, capable of handling coupled physical phenomena in engineering simulations.

tools.name: short-crack-model
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element model for short cracks with crystal plasticity and phase-field
tools.detailed_description: A specialized finite element model that incorporates crystal plasticity and phase-field modeling to simulate the geometry and propagation of short cracks in materials.

tools.name: DAFoam
tools.one_line_profile: Discrete Adjoint solver with OpenFOAM for design optimization
tools.detailed_description: An open-source derivative of OpenFOAM that implements the discrete adjoint method for high-fidelity multidisciplinary design optimization (MDO) in fluid dynamics.

tools.name: mechanoChemFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Library for modeling mechano-chemical problems using FEM
tools.detailed_description: A finite element library built upon deal.II, PETSc, and Trilinos for modeling coupled mechano-chemical problems, such as battery mechanics or corrosion.

tools.name: PyMFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for the MFEM finite element library
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface for MFEM (Modular Finite Element Methods), enabling high-performance finite element simulations and rapid prototyping using Python scripts.

tools.name: MFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight, scalable C++ library for finite element methods
tools.detailed_description: A modular parallel C++ library for finite element methods, featuring support for high-order elements, adaptive mesh refinement, and scalable solvers for multiphysics problems.

tools.name: BLAS-on-flash
tools.one_line_profile: Linear algebra subroutines for SSD-resident matrices
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing BLAS (Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) operations for very large dense and sparse matrices stored on SSDs, enabling out-of-core scientific computing.

tools.name: FLARE
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Learning of Atomistic Rare Events (FLARE)
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python package for creating fast and accurate interatomic potentials using machine learning, designed for molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: pair_nequip_allegro
tools.one_line_profile: LAMMPS interface for NequIP and Allegro ML potentials
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that provides LAMMPS pair styles for deploying NequIP and Allegro deep learning interatomic potentials in large-scale molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: fenitop
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization library based on FEniCSx
tools.detailed_description: A topology optimization tool built on FEniCSx that supports parallel computing, allowing for the optimization of material distribution in engineering structures.

tools.name: Aither
tools.one_line_profile: 3D block-structured Navier-Stokes solver
tools.detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics (CFD) solver for the Navier-Stokes equations, featuring block-structured grids and explicit/implicit time integration schemes.

tools.name: FEMcy
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel finite element solver based on Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A portable and parallel finite element solver implemented using the Taichi programming language, supporting CPU and GPU acceleration for structural simulations.

tools.name: Morpheus
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic matrix type and algorithms for sparse matrices
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library providing dynamic matrix types and algorithms for sparse matrix computations, designed to facilitate high-performance scientific computing.

tools.name: YAKL
tools.one_line_profile: C++ framework for performance portability (Kokkos Layer)
tools.detailed_description: A simple C++ framework acting as a layer over Kokkos to provide performance portability for scientific codes, particularly for porting Fortran models to C++ and GPUs.

tools.name: DDalphaAMG
tools.one_line_profile: Multigrid solver for Lattice QCD Wilson Clover fermions
tools.detailed_description: A specialized adaptive algebraic multigrid solver library designed for inverting the Wilson Clover fermion matrix in Lattice Quantum Chromodynamics (Lattice QCD) simulations.

tools.name: PETSc-FEM
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel multi-physics finite element program based on PETSc
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose, parallel finite element program developed for solving multi-physics problems, leveraging the PETSc library for scalable numerical linear algebra.

tools.name: Hybrid-Fortran
tools.one_line_profile: Unified performance portability for Fortran with CUDA/OpenACC/OpenMP
tools.detailed_description: A framework/utility to accelerate Fortran scientific codes using CUDA, OpenACC, and OpenMP in a unified and performance-portable manner.

tools.name: multiphenicsx
tools.one_line_profile: Prototyping tool for multiphysics problems in FEniCSx
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that facilitates the easy prototyping and implementation of multiphysics problems within the FEniCSx finite element framework.

tools.name: HybridQ
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid quantum circuit simulation platform
tools.detailed_description: A highly extensible platform for simulating large-scale quantum circuits on various hardware architectures, supporting both noiseless and noisy simulations with HPC integration.

tools.name: swSim
tools.one_line_profile: Solid Wave Simulation for ultrasonic NDE
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated finite difference solver for heterogeneous, anisotropic elastodynamic equations, specifically designed for ultrasonic Nondestructive Evaluation (NDE) simulations.

tools.name: SOLVERLAB
tools.one_line_profile: PDE solver lab using SALOME/MEDCoupling and PETSc
tools.detailed_description: A laboratory environment for developing PDE solvers, integrating SALOME/MEDCoupling for mesh handling and PETSc for linear algebra and solver capabilities.

tools.name: Baram
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly GUI and platform for OpenFOAM CFD simulations
tools.detailed_description: Baram is an open-source graphical user interface and platform designed to make Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) accessible. It wraps OpenFOAM solvers, providing a streamlined workflow for setting up, running, and analyzing simulations without deep command-line expertise.

tools.name: volume_distribution
tools.one_line_profile: Library for distributing 3D vectors inside a mesh volume
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for generating point distributions within the volume of a 3D mesh. This is useful for particle initialization in simulations, procedural generation, and geometry processing tasks where volumetric sampling is required.

tools.name: Phase
tools.one_line_profile: Unstructured 2D multiphase solver with immersed boundary methods
tools.detailed_description: Phase is a C++ solver for simulating multiphase flows on unstructured grids. It employs immersed boundary methods to handle complex geometries and fluid-structure interactions, suitable for research in fluid dynamics.

tools.name: petsc-hs
tools.one_line_profile: Haskell bindings for PETSc and SLEPc scientific computing libraries
tools.detailed_description: Provides Haskell bindings to the PETSc (Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation) and SLEPc libraries, enabling high-performance scientific computing and linear algebra operations within the Haskell programming environment.

tools.name: sparse-linear-algebra
tools.one_line_profile: Native Haskell library for sparse linear algebra computations
tools.detailed_description: A pure Haskell library for numerical computation focusing on sparse linear algebra. It provides data structures and algorithms for handling sparse matrices, suitable for scientific applications requiring linear solvers in Haskell.

tools.name: Maia
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed algorithms and manipulations for CGNS meshes
tools.detailed_description: Maia is a Python library developed by ONERA for handling CGNS (CFD General Notation System) meshes in a massively parallel distributed environment. It provides tools for mesh partitioning, reordering, and data exchange in HPC workflows.

tools.name: Paradigm
tools.one_line_profile: Library for managing meshes in massively parallel environments
tools.detailed_description: Paradigm is a C library from ONERA designed to manage mesh data structures in distributed memory environments. It facilitates the development of parallel solvers by handling mesh connectivity and data distribution.

tools.name: cuda-multigrid
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated multigrid solver for Poisson's equation
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA-based implementation of a geometric multigrid solver for the 2D Poisson equation. It leverages GPU acceleration to provide high-performance solutions for elliptic PDEs.

tools.name: PyPartMC
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface to the PartMC particle-resolved Monte Carlo model
tools.detailed_description: PyPartMC provides Python bindings for PartMC, a particle-resolved Monte Carlo model for simulating atmospheric aerosol dynamics. It enables researchers to perform complex atmospheric simulations and analysis using Python ecosystems.

tools.name: Owl ODE
tools.one_line_profile: Differential equation solvers for the Owl scientific computing library
tools.detailed_description: Owl ODE is a library providing a collection of Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) solvers for the Owl scientific computing ecosystem in OCaml. It supports various integration schemes for simulating dynamic systems.

tools.name: AthenaPK
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable astrophysical fluid dynamics code
tools.detailed_description: AthenaPK is a performance-portable version of the Athena++ astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code. It is built on the Parthenon AMR framework and Kokkos, allowing it to run efficiently on diverse HPC architectures including GPUs.

tools.name: Parthenon
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) framework
tools.detailed_description: Parthenon is a high-performance, portable Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) framework derived from Athena++. It serves as an infrastructure for building grid-based simulation codes that can run on CPUs and GPUs using Kokkos.

tools.name: DOT
tools.one_line_profile: Decomposed Optimization Time Integration for deformation dynamics
tools.detailed_description: DOT (Decomposed Optimization Time Integration) is a simulation method and library for fast, reliable simulation of deformation dynamics. It uses domain-decomposed optimization to enable efficient convergence for frame-rate time-steps in graphics and mechanics simulations.

tools.name: PERMON
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel solvers for quadratic programming and SVMs based on PETSc
tools.detailed_description: PERMON is a library for solving quadratic programming (QP) problems and support vector machines (SVMs), built on top of PETSc. It is designed for massive parallelism and includes solvers for contact problems in mechanics.

tools.name: GeoSlicer
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for digital rocks physics and micro-CT image analysis
tools.detailed_description: GeoSlicer is an open-source platform for digital rock physics, enabling analysis of micro-CT, CT, and borehole images. It includes tools for segmentation, porosity/permeability analysis, and flow simulation in porous media.

tools.name: PETSc
tools.one_line_profile: Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation
tools.detailed_description: PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable (parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial differential equations. It is a foundational library for HPC, providing linear and nonlinear solvers.

tools.name: Phoebe
tools.one_line_profile: Solver for phonon and electron Boltzmann transport equations
tools.detailed_description: Phoebe is a high-performance C++ code for solving the Boltzmann transport equation for phonons and electrons. It is used to calculate transport properties like thermal conductivity and electron mobility in materials.

tools.name: porousMultiphaseFoam
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM toolbox for porous multiphase flow
tools.detailed_description: porousMultiphaseFoam is a toolbox developed for OpenFOAM to simulate multiphase flow in porous media. It extends OpenFOAM's capabilities for applications in hydrology, reservoir engineering, and environmental science.

tools.name: PISM
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Ice Sheet Model
tools.detailed_description: PISM is an open-source, parallel, high-resolution ice sheet model. It is used to simulate the dynamics of ice sheets and glaciers for climate research and sea-level rise projections.

tools.name: euler2d_kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Kokkos-based 2D Euler equation solver
tools.detailed_description: A finite volume solver for the 2D Euler equations implemented using the Kokkos performance portability library. It serves as a reference implementation and benchmark for developing portable HPC fluid dynamics codes.

tools.name: euler_kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Compressible hydro and MHD solver using MPI+Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A compressible hydrodynamics and magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) solver implementing 2nd order Godunov schemes. It utilizes MPI and Kokkos for parallel execution across CPUs and GPUs, serving as a robust research code for HPC methods.

tools.name: ppkMHD
tools.one_line_profile: MPI+Kokkos spectral difference method implementation
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of high-order spectral difference methods (SDM) for magnetohydrodynamics (MHD), accelerated with MPI and Kokkos. It targets high-performance simulation on modern hardware architectures.

tools.name: ramsesGPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-optimized astrophysics MHD simulation code
tools.detailed_description: An astrophysics Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulation code optimized for large GPU clusters. It is designed to perform high-resolution simulations of astrophysical phenomena using massive parallelism.

tools.name: s-blas
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse linear algebra kernels for multi-GPU scale-up platforms
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing sparse linear algebra kernels (SpMV, SpTRSV, SpTrans, SpMM) optimized for single-node multi-GPU platforms like NVIDIA DGX, developed by PNNL.

tools.name: polysolve
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper library for various linear and non-linear solvers
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library that provides a unified interface to various linear and non-linear solvers, designed to be easy to use within finite element applications like PolyFEM.

tools.name: dealii-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: Adapter to couple deal.II solvers with preCICE
tools.detailed_description: An adapter allowing the coupling of structural solvers written with the deal.II finite element library to other solvers via the preCICE coupling ecosystem.

tools.name: fenicsx-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: Adapter to couple FEniCSx solvers with preCICE
tools.detailed_description: An adapter enabling the integration of FEniCSx-based solvers into partitioned multi-physics simulations managed by the preCICE coupling library.

tools.name: openfoam-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: Adapter to couple OpenFOAM solvers with preCICE
tools.detailed_description: A plugin adapter for OpenFOAM that allows it to be coupled with other solvers (e.g., for Fluid-Structure Interaction) using the preCICE coupling library.

tools.name: preCICE
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling library for partitioned multi-physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance coupling library for partitioned multi-physics and multi-scale simulations, supporting surface and volume coupling with black-box solver integration.

tools.name: CFDTool
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for CFD simulation with OpenFOAM/SU2
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox providing an easy-to-use interface for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations, integrating solvers like OpenFOAM and SU2.

tools.name: FEATool Multiphysics
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated FEA and Multi-Physics simulation platform for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A fully integrated physics simulation platform for MATLAB, supporting Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and interfacing with FEniCS, OpenFOAM, and SU2 solvers.

tools.name: PyAMG
tools.one_line_profile: Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers in Python
tools.detailed_description: A library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers for solving large sparse linear systems, commonly arising in solving partial differential equations.

tools.name: sunode
tools.one_line_profile: Fast ODE solver with PyMC support
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for solving Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs) efficiently, with specific support for derivatives required by probabilistic programming in PyMC.

tools.name: pymor-deal.II
tools.one_line_profile: Bindings for deal.II within the pyMOR framework
tools.detailed_description: Provides bindings to use the deal.II finite element library within pyMOR, a library for Model Order Reduction.

tools.name: python-graphblas
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for GraphBLAS sparse linear algebra
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the GraphBLAS standard, providing high-performance sparse linear algebra primitives often used in graph analytics and scientific computing.

tools.name: pyro2
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for hydrodynamics explorations and prototyping
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed for teaching and prototyping computational hydrodynamics and compressible flow simulations.

tools.name: Cfd
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) workbench for FreeCAD
tools.detailed_description: A FreeCAD workbench that provides a GUI for setting up and running CFD simulations using OpenFOAM and FEniCS solvers.

tools.name: trng4
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel pseudo-random number generator library for Monte Carlo
tools.detailed_description: A state-of-the-art C++ library for generating pseudo-random numbers, specifically designed for sequential and parallel Monte Carlo simulations.

tools.name: raptor
tools.one_line_profile: High performance algebraic multigrid solver
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose, high-performance Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solver library written in C++.

tools.name: P3DFFT++
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel 3D Fast Fourier Transform library for multiscale simulations
tools.detailed_description: P3DFFT++ is a high-performance library for computing parallel Fast Fourier Transforms (FFT) in three dimensions. It is designed for simulating multiscale phenomena and supports 1D, 2D, and 3D domain decomposition using MPI. It serves as a core component for spectral methods in CFD and materials science.

tools.name: PSBLAS
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Sparse Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms library
tools.detailed_description: PSBLAS (Parallel Sparse Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) is a library that implements sparse linear algebra operations on distributed memory parallel computers. It provides a framework for iterative solvers and preconditioners, essential for large-scale scientific simulations.

tools.name: Zapdos
tools.one_line_profile: Plasma simulation application based on the MOOSE framework
tools.detailed_description: Zapdos is an open-source application built on the MOOSE framework for simulating plasma physics. It leverages MOOSE's finite element capabilities to model plasma dynamics, suitable for research in plasma processing and fusion.

tools.name: SimGrid
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for simulation of distributed computer systems (Cloud, HPC, Grid)
tools.detailed_description: SimGrid is a scientific instrument for studying the behavior of large-scale distributed systems such as Grids, Clouds, HPC clusters, and Fog Computing. It allows researchers to simulate algorithms and applications to evaluate performance and correctness.

tools.name: cudaParticlesFoam
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated particle tracking extension for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: cudaParticlesFoam is a library that provides GPU acceleration for Lagrangian particle tracking within the OpenFOAM CFD toolbox. It offloads particle calculations to CUDA-enabled GPUs, significantly speeding up multiphase flow simulations.

tools.name: sprs
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse linear algebra library for Rust
tools.detailed_description: sprs is a library for sparse matrix computations in Rust. It provides data structures and algorithms for sparse linear algebra, which are fundamental for implementing scientific solvers and simulations in the Rust ecosystem.

tools.name: SPARTA
tools.one_line_profile: Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) code for rarefied gas dynamics
tools.detailed_description: SPARTA is a parallel DSMC code for simulating low-density gases. It is designed to run efficiently on large-scale parallel computers and is used for modeling rarefied gas flows, such as spacecraft re-entry or vacuum systems.

tools.name: SPECTER
tools.one_line_profile: High-order PDE solver using Fourier Continuation methods
tools.detailed_description: SPECTER is a PDE solver focused on Navier-Stokes and related equations. It employs Fourier Continuation (FC-Gram) expansions to handle arbitrary boundary conditions with high accuracy and is parallelized using MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA.

tools.name: SPH-EXA
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel SPH (Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics) simulation code
tools.detailed_description: SPH-EXA is a C++20 simulation framework for performing hydrodynamics simulations using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) method. It is optimized for modern HPC architectures, supporting MPI, OpenMP, CUDA, and HIP for massive parallelism.

tools.name: SST Elements
tools.one_line_profile: Component library for the Structural Simulation Toolkit (SST)
tools.detailed_description: SST Elements provides a collection of simulation components (processors, memory, network) for the Structural Simulation Toolkit. It is used to simulate and evaluate the performance of future high-performance computing architectures.

tools.name: Stan Math Library
tools.one_line_profile: C++ template library for automatic differentiation and probabilistic modeling
tools.detailed_description: The Stan Math Library provides robust, high-performance automatic differentiation (forward, reverse, and mixed modes) and a comprehensive set of mathematical functions. It is the computational engine behind the Stan probabilistic programming language, widely used for Bayesian inference and statistical modeling.

tools.name: SU2
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source suite for multiphysics simulation and design optimization
tools.detailed_description: SU2 is a comprehensive suite for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) and performing PDE-constrained optimization. It is widely used in aerodynamics, computational fluid dynamics (CFD), and multiphysics problems, featuring adjoint-based shape optimization capabilities.

tools.name: TopOpt_in_PETSc_wrapped_in_Python
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization framework using PETSc and Python
tools.detailed_description: This tool provides a Python wrapper and extended functionality for topology optimization using the PETSc library. It enables efficient solving of large-scale structural optimization problems by leveraging PETSc's parallel linear algebra capabilities.

tools.name: Sundial
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation model for time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: Sundial is a family of highly capable foundation models designed for time series analysis. It provides pre-trained models for tasks such as forecasting, classification, and anomaly detection across various scientific and industrial domains.

tools.name: TopOpt_in_PETSc
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization framework for linear elastic problems using PETSc
tools.detailed_description: A scalable topology optimization solver for 3D linear elastic minimum compliance problems, built on top of the PETSc framework for high-performance computing.

tools.name: TopOpt_in_PETSc_Transient
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization solver for time-dependent linear elastic problems
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the TopOpt_in_PETSc framework focusing on topology optimization for time-dependent linear elastic problems on 3D Cartesian grids.

tools.name: ForTrilinos
tools.one_line_profile: Object-oriented Fortran interfaces to Trilinos C++ packages
tools.detailed_description: Provides portable, object-oriented Fortran interfaces to the Trilinos C++ scientific software libraries, enabling Fortran-based HPC applications to leverage Trilinos solvers.

tools.name: Trilinos
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of open-source software libraries for scientific applications
tools.detailed_description: A massive collection of reusable scientific software libraries, known as packages, designed for the solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and scientific problems.

tools.name: trotter-suzuki-mpi
tools.one_line_profile: Massively Parallel Trotter-Suzuki Solver for quantum simulations
tools.detailed_description: A massively parallel implementation of the Trotter-Suzuki decomposition method for solving quantum spin systems and other matrix exponentiation problems.

tools.name: JAXFLUIDS
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Fluid Dynamics Package using JAX
tools.detailed_description: A fully differentiable computational fluid dynamics (CFD) solver written in Python using JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization and machine learning integration for fluid problems.

tools.name: turbinesFoam
tools.one_line_profile: Actuator line modeling extension library for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: An extension library for OpenFOAM that implements actuator line modeling (ALM) for simulating wind and hydrokinetic turbines.

tools.name: quagmire
tools.one_line_profile: Surface process framework on unstructured meshes
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for modeling surface processes (erosion, transport) on highly scalable unstructured meshes, part of the Underworld geodynamics ecosystem.

tools.name: underworld2
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel PIC-FEM code for Geodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, particle-in-cell, finite element code designed for large-scale geodynamics simulations, allowing for the modeling of complex fluid flows in the Earth's mantle and lithosphere.

tools.name: hybridCentralSolvers
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of hybrid Central solvers for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A collection of solvers for OpenFOAM implementing hybrid central schemes for compressible flows, including one-phase, two-phase, and multicomponent versions.

tools.name: libAcoustics
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM library for far-field noise computation
tools.detailed_description: An OpenFOAM library dedicated to computing far-field noise (acoustics) from CFD simulations, implementing acoustic analogies.

tools.name: DRLinFluids
tools.one_line_profile: Platform coupling Deep Reinforcement Learning and OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform that integrates Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) algorithms with OpenFOAM for flow control and optimization problems in fluid dynamics.

tools.name: vistle
tools.one_line_profile: High-Performance Simulation and Parallel Visualization Environment
tools.detailed_description: A software environment designed for high-performance simulation and parallel visualization, supporting distributed data processing and rendering on HPC clusters.

tools.name: waiwera
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel geothermal flow simulator
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, open-source simulator for geothermal flow, heat transport, and solute transport in porous media, designed for geothermal reservoir modeling.

tools.name: WfCommons
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Enabling Scientific Workflow Research
tools.detailed_description: A framework for generating synthetic scientific workflow traces and instances to support research and development of scientific workflow management systems.

tools.name: TopADD_2D_3D_Arbitrary_TopOpt_in_PETSc
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel topology optimization framework for arbitrary domains
tools.detailed_description: A 2D/3D integrated topology optimization parallel-computing framework capable of handling arbitrary design domains using PETSc.

tools.name: wrench
tools.one_line_profile: Cyberinfrastructure Simulation Workbench
tools.detailed_description: A simulation framework for building simulators of distributed computing platforms (clouds, grids, clusters) to study scientific workflow execution and resource management.

tools.name: ofpp
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM Python Parser for converting output data to Numpy arrays
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to parse OpenFOAM output files and convert the data into Numpy arrays, facilitating post-processing and data analysis in scientific computing workflows.

tools.name: navier_stokes_multigrid
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Navier-Stokes solver using pressure-correction and parallel multigrid
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of a 3D Navier-Stokes equation solver utilizing a pressure-correction scheme and parallel multigrid v-cycle for efficient fluid dynamics simulation.

tools.name: libyt
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for in-situ analysis and visualization connecting simulations with yt
tools.detailed_description: A library that enables in-situ analysis and visualization for simulations written in C/C++ by bridging them with the Python-based 'yt' analysis toolkit, allowing researchers to analyze data during simulation runtime.

tools.name: turbulent-cfd
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated turbulent CFD solver using CUDA and Vulkan
tools.detailed_description: A Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver capable of handling turbulence, optimized for performance on CPUs and GPUs using CUDA and Vulkan APIs.

tools.name: pystella
tools.one_line_profile: Code generator for grid-based PDE solving on CPUs and GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based code generator designed to automate the creation of high-performance code for solving grid-based Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) on both CPU and GPU architectures.

tools.name: zpc
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel computing library designed for physics-based simulations
tools.detailed_description: The Zenus Parallel Computing (ZPC) library provides infrastructure for developing high-performance, physics-based simulations, focusing on parallel execution capabilities.

tools.name: fdtd3d
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance FDTD electromagnetics solver with MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA support
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) solver for electromagnetics, supporting 1D, 2D, and 3D simulations with parallel acceleration via MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA across multiple architectures.

tools.name: dugksFoam
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM solver for Boltzmann model equation using discrete unified gas kinetic scheme
tools.detailed_description: A specialized solver implemented within the OpenFOAM framework that solves the Boltzmann model equation using the Discrete Unified Gas Kinetic Scheme (DUGKS), suitable for multiscale flow simulations.
